headline: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) Expands Life Sciences Cloud With Takeda Partnership
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) announced a significant partnership with Takeda, selecting its Life Sciences Cloud for customer engagement, which, combined with an expanded partnership with Informatica, underscores its strategic focus on enhancing AI-driven solutions in the healthcare sector. This aligns with client announcements and integrations initiated within the same month. Over the past month, Salesforce's shares moved 16% amid these developments, during which the broader market saw a modest...

headline: SALESFORCE : UBS reiterates its Neutral rating
summary: UBS confirms his opinion on the stock and remains Neutral. The target price is lowered from USD 340 to USD 320.

headline: KeyBanc still expects Veeva to retain majority of CRM customers
summary: KeyBanc notes that Salesforce (CRM) announced that Takeda has selected Salesforce Life Sciences Cloud for Customer Engagement. The company will leverage Salesforce’s platform, including Agentforce and Data Cloud, to deploy personalized AI agents, supporting operations from medical to commercial and patient support functions. The loss of Takeda to Salesforce follows news late last year of a different Top 20 pharma company choosing to develop a customized solution with Salesforce instead of Vault

headline: Salesforce, GSA announce collaboration to lower price of Slack
summary: The U.S. General Services Administration announced another OneGov agreement. GSA and Salesforce (CRM) have teamed up to lower the price of Slack. Through this strategic partnership, Salesforce will offer Slack Enterprise Grid, a collaboration solution for large, complex organizations that offers enterprise-grade security, scalability, and centralized administrative control, at a temporary price reduction of 90% and almost 70% off per user on Slack AI for Enterprise to every federal agency.
